column46: cell type
column49: The ATAC-seq library construction was performed as previously described (Buenrostro et al, 2013) with the additional following step
column51: Library preparation was performed on Dnase-treated RNA using the Illumina Truseq Stranded Total RNA Library Kit (Illumina 20020596). The Truseq RNA UD Indexes were used for the adapter ligation step (Illumina 20020591). Samples were normalized to a concentration of 250 ng for input, and 1 ul of ERCC spike-in Mix 1 (Thermo Fisher 4456740) diluted 1:200 was added to the samples. Minor protocol modifications were made
column54: Library preparation was performed on Dnase-treated RNA using the Illumina Truseq Stranded Total RNA Library Kit (Illumina 20020596). The Truseq RNA UD Indexes were used for the adapter ligation step (Illumina 20020591). Samples were normalized to a concentration of 500 ng for input, and 1 ul of ERCC spike-in Mix 1 (Thermo Fisher 4456740) diluted 1:200 was added to the samples. Minor protocol modifications were made

column12: T47D were maintained at 37°C with 5% CO2 and passaged every 2-3 days at a 1:3 split ratio, according to ATCC recommendations. Complete culture media comprised of RPMI-1640 that was supplemented with 10% FBS,10μg/ml insulin (Sigma-Aldrich cat# 91077C), 1x penicillin/streptomycin, and 1x glutamax. After transduction with pLKO-shCtrl, cells were selected and maintained in media containing 2 ug/ml puromycin. Cells were then hormone deprived for 3 days prior to cryopreservation. At a later day, these same cells were thawed and immediately used for the transposase reaction.
column14: ATAC-seq experiments were performed as previously described (Buenrostro et al., 2013). Cells were previously cryopreserved and thawed immediately preceding the experiment. 50,000 alive cells were used for the experiment. Samples were purified with a MinElute Reaction Cleanup kit (Qiagen cat# 28206) and DNA eluted in 10μl of EB Buffer.
column15: RNA-seq differential expression was determined using DESeq2 v1.18.1 and R (version 3.4.1) with q-value <0.05. Ruvseq v1.12.0 was used for factor analysis to remove count based on ERCC spike-in. GSEA analysis was performed using gsea-3.0.jar. These additional analysis steps were included in the Diderote LSF-RNAseq Pipeline., Homer annotatePeaks v4.8.3 was used for peak  annotation and for assigning peaks to genes., Bedtools v2.26.0 intersect was used to determine peak overlaps.
column21: University of Miami Miller School of Medicine
column38: Paired-end ATAC-seq fastq files were processed using the ATAC-seq Pipeline from the Kundaje Lab (https://github.com/kundajelab/atac_dnase_pipelines). Reads were trimmed using cutadapt v1.9.1 using the following parameters: -m 5. Reads were aligned to the hg19 genome using Bowtie2 v2.2.6, and the SAMtools v1.7 was used to convert the output files into the BAM format using default parameters. Duplicate reads were removed using Picard tool v1.126 using default parameters. Shuf was used to subsample reads to 50 million. Peaks were called using MACS2 v2.1.0 using default parameters
column39: Single-end ChIP-seq fastq files were processed using the AQUAS ChIP-seq Pipeline from the Kundaje Lab (https://github.com/kundajelab/chipseq_pipeline). Reads were trimmed using cutadapt v1.9.1. Reads were aligned to the hg19 genome using Bowtie2 v2.2.6, and the SAMtools v1.7 was used to convert the output file to the BAM format. Duplicates were removed using Picard Tools v1.126. Peaks were called/signal tracks were generated using MACS2 v2.1.0, and peaks with fold change > 4 compared to input and a FDR < 0.05 were used for subsequent analysis. Only default parameters were used.
column40: Single-end RNA-seq fastq files were processed using the LSF-RNAseq Pipeline from Diderote (https://github.com/diderote/LSF-RNAseq). Reads were trimmed using cutadapt v2.3 with the following parameters: -j 4 --netseq-trim
column42: The processed data files are in bigWig format containing the indexed tag chromosome coordinates and score produced from MACS2 peak calling.
column46: Mammary gland ductal carcarcinoma epithelial cells derived from metastatic site
column49: size selection was performed by using the AMPure XP beads (Beckman Coulter #A63881) at 1.8x the PCR volume to remove fragments smaller than 100 bp. To determine the average fragment size of each library, samples were run through a High-sensitivity DNA screentape (Agilent Technologies cat# 5067-5584) following the manufacturer’s instructions on an Agilent Technologies 2200 TapeStation machine. To determine the concentration of each library, Qubit dsDNA high sensitivity reagents (Thermo Fisher Scientific cat# Q32851) were used following the manufacturer’s instructions on a Qubit 3 fluorometer.

column12: T47D were maintained at 37°C with 5% CO2 and passaged every 2-3 days at a 1:3 split ratio, according to ATCC recommendations. Complete culture media comprised of RPMI-1640 that was supplemented with 10% FBS,10μg/ml insulin (Sigma-Aldrich cat# 91077C), 1x penicillin/streptomycin, and 1x glutamax. After transduction with pLKO-shCtrl, cells were selected and maintained in media containing 2 ug/ml puromycin. Cells were then hormone deprived for 3 days prior to 4 hrs of E2 treatment followed by cryopreservation. At a later day, these same cells were thawed and immediately used for the transposase reaction.

These additional analysis steps were included in the Diderote LSF-RNAseq Pipeline., Homer annotatePeaks v4.8.3 was used for peak  annotation and for assigning peaks to genes., Bedtools v2.26.0 intersect was used to determine peak overlaps.

Peaks were called/signal tracks were generated using MACS2 v2.1.0, and peaks with fold change > 4 compared to input and a FDR < 0.05 were used for subsequent analysis. Only default parameters were used.
column40: Single-end RNA-seq fastq files were processed using the LSF-RNAseq Pipeline from Diderote (https://github.com/diderote/LSF-RNAseq). Reads were trimmed using cutadapt v2.3 with the following parameters: -j 4 --netseq-trim

column49: size selection was performed by using the AMPure XP beads (Beckman Coulter #A63881) at 1.8x the PCR volume to remove fragments smaller than 100 bp. To determine the concentration of each library, Qubit dsDNA high sensitivity reagents (Thermo Fisher Scientific cat# Q32851) were used following the manufacturer’s instructions on a Qubit 3 fluorometer.

column14: ATAC-seq experiments were performed as previously described (Buenrostro et al., 2013). column15: RNA-seq differential expression was determined using DESeq2 v1.18.1 and R (version 3.4.1) with q-value <0.05. column12: T47D were maintained at 37°C with 5% CO2 and passaged every 2-3 days at a 1:3 split ratio, according to ATCC recommendations. Complete culture media comprised of RPMI-1640 that was supplemented with 10% FBS,10μg/ml insulin (Sigma-Aldrich cat# 91077C), 1x penicillin/streptomycin, and 1x glutamax. After transduction with LT3GEPIR-shRenilla Luciferase, cells were selected and maintained in media containing 2 ug/ml puromycin. Cells were treated with 100 ng/ml doxycycline for 5 days. After two days of doxycycline treatment, cells were washed and cultured in hormone-deprived media containing 100 ng/ml doxycycline for 3 days. Cells were then cross-linked and collected for ChIP-seq.
column14: Cells were grown to 80% confluence on 150cm plates and washed once with PBS and fixed with 1% formaldehyde (Thermo Fisher #28908) in 10 ml PBS for 10 min. To quench the cross-linking reaction, 1/20 volume of 2.5 M glycine was added to the plate for a final concentration of 0.125M for 5 min. The supernatant was aspirated, and the cells were washed twice with 5 ml PBS and harvested on ice using cell scrapers into 15ml sonication tubes (Diagenode cat# C01020031). Cells were pelleted at 1000g for 5 min at 4°C, washed 1x with 5 ml cold PBS, and pelleted once more. Cell pellet collected from 6 plates of cells was resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 1 (50 mM HEPES-KOH, pH 7.5; 140 mM NaCl, 1mM EDTA, 10% glycerol, 0.5% NP-40, 0.25% Triton X-100), allowed to rotate for 10 min at 4°C, and pelleted at 1000 x g for 5 min at 4°C. Cells were then resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 2 (10 mM Tris-HCL pH 8.0, 200 mM NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, 0.5 mM EGTA), allowed to rotate for 10 min at room temperature, and pelleted at 1000 x g for 5 min at 4°C. Cells were then resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 3 (10 mM Tris-HCl pH 8, 100 mM NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, 0.5 mM EGTA, 0.1% Na-Deoxycholate, 0.5% N-lauroylsarcosine) and then sonicated on a Bioruptor Pico at 4°C for 20min of 30’’ ON-OFF cycles with 1.2 g of sonication beads. After sonication, samples were transferred to 2 separate 1.5 ml microtube and centrifuged at 20,000 x g for 15 minutes at 4°C. The supernatant was transferred to new 15 ml tubes. To check sonication efficiency, 20µl of sonicated samples was transferred to a new microtube with 80µl PBS and incubated at 65°C for 3hr on an Eppendorf Thermomixer shaking at 1000rpm to decrosslink. DNA was purified with the QIAquick PCR Purification Kit (Qiagen cat# 28106) and eluted in 50µl EB buffer. 1 ug of decrosslinked chromatin from each sample were run in a 1% agarose gel at 100V for 45min and imaged on a Bio-rad ChemiDoc XRS+. DNA concentration in the sonicated decrosslinked samples were measured via qubit, and this concentration was then used to estimate the concentration of chromatin in the un-decrosslinked samples. 30 ug of total chromatin and 50 ng of Spike-in chromatin (Active Motif 53083) weres transferred to a 1.5ml LoBind tube (Eppendorf cat# 0030108051) and brought up to 500µl final volume with Lysis Buffer 3. 5µl was removed as input material (1%) and placed in a separate microtube at 4°C. 2µg antibody was used for each histone ChIP, and 5ug was used for transcription factor ChIP (see Key Resources table for list of antibodies) along with 1ug of Spike-in antibodies (Active Motif 61686). Antibodies were pre-bound to 50 ul of Dynabeads Protein G (Thermo Fisher 10004D), which was washed in 1 ml of 0.5% BSA in 1x PBS three times before and after overnight pre-binding at 4°C. The chromatin samples were added to the pre-bound Dynabeads and rotated end-to-end overnight at 4°C. Beads were washed 5x with 1 ml Wash Buffer (50 mM Hepes-KOH, pH 7.6; 500 mM LiCl, 1 mM EDTA, 1% NP-40; 0.5% Na-Deoxycholate) and once with 1 ml TE containing 50 mM NaCl. Beads were dried after the last wash by removing as much TE as possible. 210 ul of Elution Buffer (50 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8; 10 mM EDTA, 1% SDS) was added to each sample and 45 ul Lysis Buffer 3 plus 150 ul elution buffer were added to each input sample that was previously set aside. To elute immunocomplexes from beads, samples were incubated at 65°C for 15 minutes on an Eppendorf Thermomixer shaking at 1000rpm. Tubes were centrifuged for 3min at 2000rpm at RT and 200µl of supernatant was transferred to a new tube and reverse crosslinked overnight at 65°C. Next day, 200 ul of TE was added to each decrosslinked sample, and the samples were treated sequentially with 0.2 mg/ml RNAse A (Sigma R5503) at 37°C and 0.2 ug/ml Proteinase K (NEB P8107S) at 55°C for two hours each. DNA purification was performed with the QIAquick PCR Purification Kit (Qiagen cat# 28106) and eluted in 50µl EB buffer and quantified by Qubit., Immunoprecipitated DNA was used to generate libraries using the NEBNext Ultra DNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina (New England Biolabs cat# 7370) following the manufacturer’s instructions.
column15: RNA-seq differential expression was determined using DESeq2 v1.18.1 and R (version 3.4.1) with q-value <0.05. Ruvseq v1.12.0 was used for factor analysis to remove count based on ERCC spike-in. GSEA analysis was performed using gsea-3.0.jar. These additional analysis steps were included in the Diderote LSF-RNAseq Pipeline., Homer annotatePeaks v4.8.3 was used for peak  annotation and for assigning peaks to genes., Bedtools v2.26.0 intersect was used to determine peak overlaps.

Reads were trimmed using cutadapt v1.9.1. Reads were aligned to the hg19 genome using Bowtie2 v2.2.6, and the SAMtools v1.7 was used to convert the output file to the BAM format. Duplicates were removed using Picard Tools v1.126. Peaks were called/signal tracks were generated using MACS2 v2.1.0, and peaks with fold change > 4 compared to input and a FDR < 0.05 were used for subsequent analysis. Only default parameters were used.
column40: Single-end RNA-seq fastq files were processed using the LSF-RNAseq Pipeline from Diderote (https://github.com/diderote/LSF-RNAseq). Reads were trimmed using cutadapt v2.3 with the following parameters: -j 4 --netseq-trim
column42: The processed data files are in bigWig format containing the indexed tag chromosome coordinates and score produced from MACS2 peak calling.
column46: Mammary gland ductal carcarcinoma epithelial cells derived from metastatic site

column12: T47D were maintained at 37°C with 5% CO2 and passaged every 2-3 days at a 1:3 split ratio, according to ATCC recommendations. Complete culture media comprised of RPMI-1640 that was supplemented with 10% FBS,10μg/ml insulin (Sigma-Aldrich cat# 91077C), 1x penicillin/streptomycin, and 1x glutamax. After transduction with LT3GEPIR-shRenilla Luciferase, cells were selected and maintained in media containing 2 ug/ml puromycin. Cells were treated with 100 ng/ml doxycycline for 5 days. After two days of doxycycline treatment, cells were washed and cultured in hormone-deprived media containing 100 ng/ml doxycycline for 3 days. Cells were then cross-linked and collected for ChIP-seq.
column14: Cells were grown to 80% confluence on 150cm plates and washed once with PBS and fixed with 1% formaldehyde (Thermo Fisher #28908) in 10 ml PBS for 10 min. To quench the cross-linking reaction, 1/20 volume of 2.5 M glycine was added to the plate for a final concentration of 0.125M for 5 min. The supernatant was aspirated, and the cells were washed twice with 5 ml PBS and harvested on ice using cell scrapers into 15ml sonication tubes (Diagenode cat# C01020031). Cells were pelleted at 1000g for 5 min at 4°C, washed 1x with 5 ml cold PBS, and pelleted once more. Cell pellet collected from 6 plates of cells was resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 1 (50 mM HEPES-KOH, pH 7.5; 140 mM NaCl, 1mM EDTA, 10% glycerol, 0.5% NP-40, 0.25% Triton X-100), allowed to rotate for 10 min at 4°C, and pelleted at 1000 x g for 5 min at 4°C. Cells were then resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 2 (10 mM Tris-HCL pH 8.0, 200 mM NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, 0.5 mM EGTA), allowed to rotate for 10 min at room temperature, and pelleted at 1000 x g for 5 min at 4°C. Cells were then resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 3 (10 mM Tris-HCl pH 8, 100 mM NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, 0.5 mM EGTA, 0.1% Na-Deoxycholate, 0.5% N-lauroylsarcosine) and then sonicated on a Bioruptor Pico at 4°C for 20min of 30’’ ON-OFF cycles with 1.2 g of sonication beads. After sonication, samples were transferred to 2 separate 1.5 ml microtube and centrifuged at 20,000 x g for 15 minutes at 4°C. The supernatant was transferred to new 15 ml tubes. To check sonication efficiency, 20µl of sonicated samples was transferred to a new microtube with 80µl PBS and incubated at 65°C for 3hr on an Eppendorf Thermomixer shaking at 1000rpm to decrosslink. DNA was purified with the QIAquick PCR Purification Kit (Qiagen cat# 28106) and eluted in 50µl EB buffer. 1 ug of decrosslinked chromatin from each sample were run in a 1% agarose gel at 100V for 45min and imaged on a Bio-rad ChemiDoc XRS+. DNA concentration in the sonicated decrosslinked samples were measured via qubit, and this concentration was then used to estimate the concentration of chromatin in the un-decrosslinked samples. 30 ug of total chromatin and 50 ng of Spike-in chromatin (Active Motif 53083) weres transferred to a 1.5ml LoBind tube (Eppendorf cat# 0030108051) and brought up to 500µl final volume with Lysis Buffer 3. 5µl was removed as input material (1%) and placed in a separate microtube at 4°C. 2µg antibody was used for each histone ChIP, and 5ug was used for transcription factor ChIP (see Key Resources table for list of antibodies) along with 1ug of Spike-in antibodies (Active Motif 61686). Antibodies were pre-bound to 50 ul of Dynabeads Protein G (Thermo Fisher 10004D), which was washed in 1 ml of 0.5% BSA in 1x PBS three times before and after overnight pre-binding at 4°C. The chromatin samples were added to the pre-bound Dynabeads and rotated end-to-end overnight at 4°C. Beads were washed 5x with 1 ml Wash Buffer (50 mM Hepes-KOH, pH 7.6; 500 mM LiCl, 1 mM EDTA, 1% NP-40; 0.5% Na-Deoxycholate) and once with 1 ml TE containing 50 mM NaCl. Beads were dried after the last wash by removing as much TE as possible. 210 ul of Elution Buffer (50 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8; 10 mM EDTA, 1% SDS) was added to each sample and 45 ul Lysis Buffer 3 plus 150 ul elution buffer were added to each input sample that was previously set aside. To elute immunocomplexes from beads, samples were incubated at 65°C for 15 minutes on an Eppendorf Thermomixer shaking at 1000rpm. Tubes were centrifuged for 3min at 2000rpm at RT and 200µl of supernatant was transferred to a new tube and reverse crosslinked overnight at 65°C. Next day, 200 ul of TE was added to each decrosslinked sample, and the samples were treated sequentially with 0.2 mg/ml RNAse A (Sigma R5503) at 37°C and 0.2 ug/ml Proteinase K (NEB P8107S) at 55°C for two hours each. DNA purification was performed with the QIAquick PCR Purification Kit (Qiagen cat# 28106) and eluted in 50µl EB buffer and quantified by Qubit., Immunoprecipitated DNA was used to generate libraries using the NEBNext Ultra DNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina (New England Biolabs cat# 7370) following the manufacturer’s instructions.
column15: RNA-seq differential expression was determined using DESeq2 v1.18.1 and R (version 3.4.1) with q-value <0.05. Ruvseq v1.12.0 was used for factor analysis to remove count based on ERCC spike-in. GSEA analysis was performed using gsea-3.0.jar. These additional analysis steps were included in the Diderote LSF-RNAseq Pipeline., Homer annotatePeaks v4.8.3 was used for peak  annotation and for assigning peaks to genes., Bedtools v2.26.0 intersect was used to determine peak overlaps.

Peaks were called/signal tracks were generated using MACS2 v2.1.0, and peaks with fold change > 4 compared to input and a FDR < 0.05 were used for subsequent analysis. Only default parameters were used.
column40: Single-end RNA-seq fastq files were processed using the LSF-RNAseq Pipeline from Diderote (https://github.com/diderote/LSF-RNAseq). Reads were trimmed using cutadapt v2.3 with the following parameters: -j 4 --netseq-trim
column42: The processed data files are in bigWig format containing the indexed tag chromosome coordinates and score produced from MACS2 peak calling.
column46: Mammary gland ductal carcarcinoma epithelial cells derived from metastatic site

column12: T47D were maintained at 37°C with 5% CO2 and passaged every 2-3 days at a 1:3 split ratio, according to ATCC recommendations. Complete culture media comprised of RPMI-1640 that was supplemented with 10% FBS,10μg/ml insulin (Sigma-Aldrich cat# 91077C), 1x penicillin/streptomycin, and 1x glutamax. After transduction with pLKO-tet-on-shRING1B, cells were selected and maintained in media containing 2 ug/ml puromycin. Cells were treated with 100 ng/ml doxycycline for 5 days. After two days of doxycycline treatment, cells were washed and cultured in hormone-deprived media containing 100 ng/ml doxycycline for 3 days. Cells were then cross-linked and collected for ChIP-seq.
column14: Cells were grown to 80% confluence on 150cm plates and washed once with PBS and fixed with 1% formaldehyde (Thermo Fisher #28908) in 10 ml PBS for 10 min. To quench the cross-linking reaction, 1/20 volume of 2.5 M glycine was added to the plate for a final concentration of 0.125M for 5 min. The supernatant was aspirated, and the cells were washed twice with 5 ml PBS and harvested on ice using cell scrapers into 15ml sonication tubes (Diagenode cat# C01020031). Cells were pelleted at 1000g for 5 min at 4°C, washed 1x with 5 ml cold PBS, and pelleted once more. Cell pellet collected from 6 plates of cells was resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 1 (50 mM HEPES-KOH, pH 7.5; 140 mM NaCl, 1mM EDTA, 10% glycerol, 0.5% NP-40, 0.25% Triton X-100), allowed to rotate for 10 min at 4°C, and pelleted at 1000 x g for 5 min at 4°C. Cells were then resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 2 (10 mM Tris-HCL pH 8.0, 200 mM NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, 0.5 mM EGTA), allowed to rotate for 10 min at room temperature, and pelleted at 1000 x g for 5 min at 4°C. Cells were then resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 3 (10 mM Tris-HCl pH 8, 100 mM NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, 0.5 mM EGTA, 0.1% Na-Deoxycholate, 0.5% N-lauroylsarcosine) and then sonicated on a Bioruptor Pico at 4°C for 20min of 30’’ ON-OFF cycles with 1.2 g of sonication beads. After sonication, samples were transferred to 2 separate 1.5 ml microtube and centrifuged at 20,000 x g for 15 minutes at 4°C. The supernatant was transferred to new 15 ml tubes. To check sonication efficiency, 20µl of sonicated samples was transferred to a new microtube with 80µl PBS and incubated at 65°C for 3hr on an Eppendorf Thermomixer shaking at 1000rpm to decrosslink. DNA was purified with the QIAquick PCR Purification Kit (Qiagen cat# 28106) and eluted in 50µl EB buffer. 1 ug of decrosslinked chromatin from each sample were run in a 1% agarose gel at 100V for 45min and imaged on a Bio-rad ChemiDoc XRS+. DNA concentration in the sonicated decrosslinked samples were measured via qubit, and this concentration was then used to estimate the concentration of chromatin in the un-decrosslinked samples. 30 ug of total chromatin and 50 ng of Spike-in chromatin (Active Motif 53083) weres transferred to a 1.5ml LoBind tube (Eppendorf cat# 0030108051) and brought up to 500µl final volume with Lysis Buffer 3. 5µl was removed as input material (1%) and placed in a separate microtube at 4°C. 2µg antibody was used for each histone ChIP, and 5ug was used for transcription factor ChIP (see Key Resources table for list of antibodies) along with 1ug of Spike-in antibodies (Active Motif 61686). Antibodies were pre-bound to 50 ul of Dynabeads Protein G (Thermo Fisher 10004D), which was washed in 1 ml of 0.5% BSA in 1x PBS three times before and after overnight pre-binding at 4°C. The chromatin samples were added to the pre-bound Dynabeads and rotated end-to-end overnight at 4°C. Beads were washed 5x with 1 ml Wash Buffer (50 mM Hepes-KOH, pH 7.6; 500 mM LiCl, 1 mM EDTA, 1% NP-40; 0.5% Na-Deoxycholate) and once with 1 ml TE containing 50 mM NaCl. Beads were dried after the last wash by removing as much TE as possible. 210 ul of Elution Buffer (50 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8; 10 mM EDTA, 1% SDS) was added to each sample and 45 ul Lysis Buffer 3 plus 150 ul elution buffer were added to each input sample that was previously set aside. To elute immunocomplexes from beads, samples were incubated at 65°C for 15 minutes on an Eppendorf Thermomixer shaking at 1000rpm. Tubes were centrifuged for 3min at 2000rpm at RT and 200µl of supernatant was transferred to a new tube and reverse crosslinked overnight at 65°C. Next day, 200 ul of TE was added to each decrosslinked sample, and the samples were treated sequentially with 0.2 mg/ml RNAse A (Sigma R5503) at 37°C and 0.2 ug/ml Proteinase K (NEB P8107S) at 55°C for two hours each. DNA purification was performed with the QIAquick PCR Purification Kit (Qiagen cat# 28106) and eluted in 50µl EB buffer and quantified by Qubit., Immunoprecipitated DNA was used to generate libraries using the NEBNext Ultra DNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina (New England Biolabs cat# 7370) following the manufacturer’s instructions.
column15: RNA-seq differential expression was determined using DESeq2 v1.18.1 and R (version 3.4.1) with q-value <0.05. Ruvseq v1.12.0 was used for factor analysis to remove count based on ERCC spike-in. GSEA analysis was performed using gsea-3.0.jar. These additional analysis steps were included in the Diderote LSF-RNAseq Pipeline., Homer annotatePeaks v4.8.3 was used for peak  annotation and for assigning peaks to genes., Bedtools v2.26.0 intersect was used to determine peak overlaps.

column38: Paired-end ATAC-seq fastq files were processed using the ATAC-seq Pipeline from the Kundaje Lab (https://github.com/kundajelab/atac_dnase_pipelines). column42: The processed data files are in bigWig format containing the indexed tag chromosome coordinates and score produced from MACS2 peak calling.
column46: Mammary gland ductal carcarcinoma epithelial cells derived from metastatic site

column12: T47D were maintained at 37°C with 5% CO2 and passaged every 2-3 days at a 1:3 split ratio, according to ATCC recommendations. Complete culture media comprised of RPMI-1640 that was supplemented with 10% FBS,10μg/ml insulin (Sigma-Aldrich cat# 91077C), 1x penicillin/streptomycin, and 1x glutamax. After transduction with LT3GEPIR-shRenilla Luciferase, cells were selected and maintained in media containing 2 ug/ml puromycin. Cells were treated with 100 ng/ml doxycycline for 5 days. After two days of doxycycline treatment, cells were washed and cultured in hormone-deprived media containing 100 ng/ml doxycycline for 3 days. After hormone deprivation, cells were treated with 10 nM estradiol for 45 minutes before cross-linking with formaldehyde and collection for ChIP-seq.
column14: Cells were grown to 80% confluence on 150cm plates and washed once with PBS and fixed with 1% formaldehyde (Thermo Fisher #28908) in 10 ml PBS for 10 min. To quench the cross-linking reaction, 1/20 volume of 2.5 M glycine was added to the plate for a final concentration of 0.125M for 5 min. The supernatant was aspirated, and the cells were washed twice with 5 ml PBS and harvested on ice using cell scrapers into 15ml sonication tubes (Diagenode cat# C01020031). Cells were pelleted at 1000g for 5 min at 4°C, washed 1x with 5 ml cold PBS, and pelleted once more. Cell pellet collected from 6 plates of cells was resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 1 (50 mM HEPES-KOH, pH 7.5; 140 mM NaCl, 1mM EDTA, 10% glycerol, 0.5% NP-40, 0.25% Triton X-100), allowed to rotate for 10 min at 4°C, and pelleted at 1000 x g for 5 min at 4°C. Cells were then resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 2 (10 mM Tris-HCL pH 8.0, 200 mM NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, 0.5 mM EGTA), allowed to rotate for 10 min at room temperature, and pelleted at 1000 x g for 5 min at 4°C. Cells were then resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 3 (10 mM Tris-HCl pH 8, 100 mM NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, 0.5 mM EGTA, 0.1% Na-Deoxycholate, 0.5% N-lauroylsarcosine) and then sonicated on a Bioruptor Pico at 4°C for 20min of 30’’ ON-OFF cycles with 1.2 g of sonication beads. After sonication, samples were transferred to 2 separate 1.5 ml microtube and centrifuged at 20,000 x g for 15 minutes at 4°C. The supernatant was transferred to new 15 ml tubes. To check sonication efficiency, 20µl of sonicated samples was transferred to a new microtube with 80µl PBS and incubated at 65°C for 3hr on an Eppendorf Thermomixer shaking at 1000rpm to decrosslink. DNA was purified with the QIAquick PCR Purification Kit (Qiagen cat# 28106) and eluted in 50µl EB buffer. 1 ug of decrosslinked chromatin from each sample were run in a 1% agarose gel at 100V for 45min and imaged on a Bio-rad ChemiDoc XRS+. DNA concentration in the sonicated decrosslinked samples were measured via qubit, and this concentration was then used to estimate the concentration of chromatin in the un-decrosslinked samples. 30 ug of total chromatin and 50 ng of Spike-in chromatin (Active Motif 53083) weres transferred to a 1.5ml LoBind tube (Eppendorf cat# 0030108051) and brought up to 500µl final volume with Lysis Buffer 3. 5µl was removed as input material (1%) and placed in a separate microtube at 4°C. 2µg antibody was used for each histone ChIP, and 5ug was used for transcription factor ChIP (see Key Resources table for list of antibodies) along with 1ug of Spike-in antibodies (Active Motif 61686). Antibodies were pre-bound to 50 ul of Dynabeads Protein G (Thermo Fisher 10004D), which was washed in 1 ml of 0.5% BSA in 1x PBS three times before and after overnight pre-binding at 4°C. The chromatin samples were added to the pre-bound Dynabeads and rotated end-to-end overnight at 4°C. Beads were washed 5x with 1 ml Wash Buffer (50 mM Hepes-KOH, pH 7.6; 500 mM LiCl, 1 mM EDTA, 1% NP-40; 0.5% Na-Deoxycholate) and once with 1 ml TE containing 50 mM NaCl. Beads were dried after the last wash by removing as much TE as possible. 210 ul of Elution Buffer (50 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8; 10 mM EDTA, 1% SDS) was added to each sample and 45 ul Lysis Buffer 3 plus 150 ul elution buffer were added to each input sample that was previously set aside. To elute immunocomplexes from beads, samples were incubated at 65°C for 15 minutes on an Eppendorf Thermomixer shaking at 1000rpm. Tubes were centrifuged for 3min at 2000rpm at RT and 200µl of supernatant was transferred to a new tube and reverse crosslinked overnight at 65°C. Next day, 200 ul of TE was added to each decrosslinked sample, and the samples were treated sequentially with 0.2 mg/ml RNAse A (Sigma R5503) at 37°C and 0.2 ug/ml Proteinase K (NEB P8107S) at 55°C for two hours each. DNA purification was performed with the QIAquick PCR Purification Kit (Qiagen cat# 28106) and eluted in 50µl EB buffer and quantified by Qubit., Immunoprecipitated DNA was used to generate libraries using the NEBNext Ultra DNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina (New England Biolabs cat# 7370) following the manufacturer’s instructions.
column15: RNA-seq differential expression was determined using DESeq2 v1.18.1 and R (version 3.4.1) with q-value <0.05. Ruvseq v1.12.0 was used for factor analysis to remove count based on ERCC spike-in. GSEA analysis was performed using gsea-3.0.jar. These additional analysis steps were included in the Diderote LSF-RNAseq Pipeline., Homer annotatePeaks v4.8.3 was used for peak  annotation and for assigning peaks to genes., Bedtools v2.26.0 intersect was used to determine peak overlaps.

column38: Paired-end ATAC-seq fastq files were processed using the ATAC-seq Pipeline from the Kundaje Lab (https://github.com/kundajelab/atac_dnase_pipelines). Reads were trimmed using cutadapt v1.9.1 using the following parameters: -m 5. Reads were aligned to the hg19 genome using Bowtie2 v2.2.6, and the SAMtools v1.7 was used to convert the output files into the BAM format using default parameters. Duplicate reads were removed using Picard tool v1.126 using default parameters. Shuf was used to subsample reads to 50 million. Peaks were called using MACS2 v2.1.0 using default parameters
column39: Single-end ChIP-seq fastq files were processed using the AQUAS ChIP-seq Pipeline from the Kundaje Lab (https://github.com/kundajelab/chipseq_pipeline). Peaks were called/signal tracks were generated using MACS2 v2.1.0, and peaks with fold change > 4 compared to input and a FDR < 0.05 were used for subsequent analysis. column42: The processed data files are in bigWig format containing the indexed tag chromosome coordinates and score produced from MACS2 peak calling.
column46: Mammary gland ductal carcarcinoma epithelial cells derived from metastatic site

column12: T47D were maintained at 37°C with 5% CO2 and passaged every 2-3 days at a 1:3 split ratio, according to ATCC recommendations. Complete culture media comprised of RPMI-1640 that was supplemented with 10% FBS,10μg/ml insulin (Sigma-Aldrich cat# 91077C), 1x penicillin/streptomycin, and 1x glutamax. After transduction with pLKO-tet-on-shRING1B, cells were selected and maintained in media containing 2 ug/ml puromycin. Cells were treated with 100 ng/ml doxycycline for 5 days. After two days of doxycycline treatment, cells were washed and cultured in hormone-deprived media containing 100 ng/ml doxycycline for 3 days. After hormone deprivation, cells were treated with 10 nM estradiol for 45 minutes before cross-linking with formaldehyde and collection for ChIP-seq.
column14: Cells were grown to 80% confluence on 150cm plates and washed once with PBS and fixed with 1% formaldehyde (Thermo Fisher #28908) in 10 ml PBS for 10 min. To quench the cross-linking reaction, 1/20 volume of 2.5 M glycine was added to the plate for a final concentration of 0.125M for 5 min. The supernatant was aspirated, and the cells were washed twice with 5 ml PBS and harvested on ice using cell scrapers into 15ml sonication tubes (Diagenode cat# C01020031). Cells were pelleted at 1000g for 5 min at 4°C, washed 1x with 5 ml cold PBS, and pelleted once more. Cell pellet collected from 6 plates of cells was resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 1 (50 mM HEPES-KOH, pH 7.5; 140 mM NaCl, 1mM EDTA, 10% glycerol, 0.5% NP-40, 0.25% Triton X-100), allowed to rotate for 10 min at 4°C, and pelleted at 1000 x g for 5 min at 4°C. Cells were then resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 2 (10 mM Tris-HCL pH 8.0, 200 mM NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, 0.5 mM EGTA), allowed to rotate for 10 min at room temperature, and pelleted at 1000 x g for 5 min at 4°C. Cells were then resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 3 (10 mM Tris-HCl pH 8, 100 mM NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, 0.5 mM EGTA, 0.1% Na-Deoxycholate, 0.5% N-lauroylsarcosine) and then sonicated on a Bioruptor Pico at 4°C for 20min of 30’’ ON-OFF cycles with 1.2 g of sonication beads. After sonication, samples were transferred to 2 separate 1.5 ml microtube and centrifuged at 20,000 x g for 15 minutes at 4°C. The supernatant was transferred to new 15 ml tubes. To check sonication efficiency, 20µl of sonicated samples was transferred to a new microtube with 80µl PBS and incubated at 65°C for 3hr on an Eppendorf Thermomixer shaking at 1000rpm to decrosslink. DNA was purified with the QIAquick PCR Purification Kit (Qiagen cat# 28106) and eluted in 50µl EB buffer. 1 ug of decrosslinked chromatin from each sample were run in a 1% agarose gel at 100V for 45min and imaged on a Bio-rad ChemiDoc XRS+. DNA concentration in the sonicated decrosslinked samples were measured via qubit, and this concentration was then used to estimate the concentration of chromatin in the un-decrosslinked samples. 30 ug of total chromatin and 50 ng of Spike-in chromatin (Active Motif 53083) weres transferred to a 1.5ml LoBind tube (Eppendorf cat# 0030108051) and brought up to 500µl final volume with Lysis Buffer 3. 5µl was removed as input material (1%) and placed in a separate microtube at 4°C. 2µg antibody was used for each histone ChIP, and 5ug was used for transcription factor ChIP (see Key Resources table for list of antibodies) along with 1ug of Spike-in antibodies (Active Motif 61686). Antibodies were pre-bound to 50 ul of Dynabeads Protein G (Thermo Fisher 10004D), which was washed in 1 ml of 0.5% BSA in 1x PBS three times before and after overnight pre-binding at 4°C. The chromatin samples were added to the pre-bound Dynabeads and rotated end-to-end overnight at 4°C. Beads were washed 5x with 1 ml Wash Buffer (50 mM Hepes-KOH, pH 7.6; 500 mM LiCl, 1 mM EDTA, 1% NP-40; 0.5% Na-Deoxycholate) and once with 1 ml TE containing 50 mM NaCl. Beads were dried after the last wash by removing as much TE as possible. 210 ul of Elution Buffer (50 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8; 10 mM EDTA, 1% SDS) was added to each sample and 45 ul Lysis Buffer 3 plus 150 ul elution buffer were added to each input sample that was previously set aside. To elute immunocomplexes from beads, samples were incubated at 65°C for 15 minutes on an Eppendorf Thermomixer shaking at 1000rpm. Tubes were centrifuged for 3min at 2000rpm at RT and 200µl of supernatant was transferred to a new tube and reverse crosslinked overnight at 65°C. Next day, 200 ul of TE was added to each decrosslinked sample, and the samples were treated sequentially with 0.2 mg/ml RNAse A (Sigma R5503) at 37°C and 0.2 ug/ml Proteinase K (NEB P8107S) at 55°C for two hours each. DNA purification was performed with the QIAquick PCR Purification Kit (Qiagen cat# 28106) and eluted in 50µl EB buffer and quantified by Qubit., Immunoprecipitated DNA was used to generate libraries using the NEBNext Ultra DNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina (New England Biolabs cat# 7370) following the manufacturer’s instructions.
column15: RNA-seq differential expression was determined using DESeq2 v1.18.1 and R (version 3.4.1) with q-value <0.05. Ruvseq v1.12.0 was used for factor analysis to remove count based on ERCC spike-in. GSEA analysis was performed using gsea-3.0.jar. These additional analysis steps were included in the Diderote LSF-RNAseq Pipeline., Homer annotatePeaks v4.8.3 was used for peak  annotation and for assigning peaks to genes., Bedtools v2.26.0 intersect was used to determine peak overlaps.

column38: Paired-end ATAC-seq fastq files were processed using the ATAC-seq Pipeline from the Kundaje Lab (https://github.com/kundajelab/atac_dnase_pipelines). Reads were trimmed using cutadapt v1.9.1 using the following parameters: -m 5. Reads were aligned to the hg19 genome using Bowtie2 v2.2.6, and the SAMtools v1.7 was used to convert the output files into the BAM format using default parameters. Duplicate reads were removed using Picard tool v1.126 using default parameters. Shuf was used to subsample reads to 50 million. Peaks were called using MACS2 v2.1.0 using default parameters
column39: Single-end ChIP-seq fastq files were processed using the AQUAS ChIP-seq Pipeline from the Kundaje Lab (https://github.com/kundajelab/chipseq_pipeline). column42: The processed data files are in bigWig format containing the indexed tag chromosome coordinates and score produced from MACS2 peak calling.
column46: Mammary gland ductal carcarcinoma epithelial cells derived from metastatic site

column12: T47D were maintained at 37°C with 5% CO2 and passaged every 2-3 days at a 1:3 split ratio, according to ATCC recommendations. Complete culture media comprised of RPMI-1640 that was supplemented with 10% FBS,10μg/ml insulin (Sigma-Aldrich cat# 91077C), 1x penicillin/streptomycin, and 1x glutamax. After transduction with LT3GEPIR-shRenilla Luciferase, cells were selected and maintained in media containing 2 ug/ml puromycin. Cells were treated with 100 ng/ml doxycycline for 5 days. After two days of doxycycline treatment, cells were washed and cultured in hormone-deprived media containing 100 ng/ml doxycycline for 3 days. After hormone deprivation, cells were treated with 10 nM estradiol for 8 hours before cross-linking with formaldehyde and collection for ChIP-seq.
column14: Cells were grown to 80% confluence on 150cm plates and washed once with PBS and fixed with 1% formaldehyde (Thermo Fisher #28908) in 10 ml PBS for 10 min. To quench the cross-linking reaction, 1/20 volume of 2.5 M glycine was added to the plate for a final concentration of 0.125M for 5 min. The supernatant was aspirated, and the cells were washed twice with 5 ml PBS and harvested on ice using cell scrapers into 15ml sonication tubes (Diagenode cat# C01020031). Cells were pelleted at 1000g for 5 min at 4°C, washed 1x with 5 ml cold PBS, and pelleted once more. Cell pellet collected from 6 plates of cells was resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 1 (50 mM HEPES-KOH, pH 7.5; 140 mM NaCl, 1mM EDTA, 10% glycerol, 0.5% NP-40, 0.25% Triton X-100), allowed to rotate for 10 min at 4°C, and pelleted at 1000 x g for 5 min at 4°C. Cells were then resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 2 (10 mM Tris-HCL pH 8.0, 200 mM NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, 0.5 mM EGTA), allowed to rotate for 10 min at room temperature, and pelleted at 1000 x g for 5 min at 4°C. Cells were then resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 3 (10 mM Tris-HCl pH 8, 100 mM NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, 0.5 mM EGTA, 0.1% Na-Deoxycholate, 0.5% N-lauroylsarcosine) and then sonicated on a Bioruptor Pico at 4°C for 20min of 30’’ ON-OFF cycles with 1.2 g of sonication beads. After sonication, samples were transferred to 2 separate 1.5 ml microtube and centrifuged at 20,000 x g for 15 minutes at 4°C. The supernatant was transferred to new 15 ml tubes. To check sonication efficiency, 20µl of sonicated samples was transferred to a new microtube with 80µl PBS and incubated at 65°C for 3hr on an Eppendorf Thermomixer shaking at 1000rpm to decrosslink. DNA was purified with the QIAquick PCR Purification Kit (Qiagen cat# 28106) and eluted in 50µl EB buffer. 1 ug of decrosslinked chromatin from each sample were run in a 1% agarose gel at 100V for 45min and imaged on a Bio-rad ChemiDoc XRS+. DNA concentration in the sonicated decrosslinked samples were measured via qubit, and this concentration was then used to estimate the concentration of chromatin in the un-decrosslinked samples. 30 ug of total chromatin and 50 ng of Spike-in chromatin (Active Motif 53083) weres transferred to a 1.5ml LoBind tube (Eppendorf cat# 0030108051) and brought up to 500µl final volume with Lysis Buffer 3. 5µl was removed as input material (1%) and placed in a separate microtube at 4°C. 2µg antibody was used for each histone ChIP, and 5ug was used for transcription factor ChIP (see Key Resources table for list of antibodies) along with 1ug of Spike-in antibodies (Active Motif 61686). Antibodies were pre-bound to 50 ul of Dynabeads Protein G (Thermo Fisher 10004D), which was washed in 1 ml of 0.5% BSA in 1x PBS three times before and after overnight pre-binding at 4°C. The chromatin samples were added to the pre-bound Dynabeads and rotated end-to-end overnight at 4°C. Beads were washed 5x with 1 ml Wash Buffer (50 mM Hepes-KOH, pH 7.6; 500 mM LiCl, 1 mM EDTA, 1% NP-40; 0.5% Na-Deoxycholate) and once with 1 ml TE containing 50 mM NaCl. Beads were dried after the last wash by removing as much TE as possible. 210 ul of Elution Buffer (50 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8; 10 mM EDTA, 1% SDS) was added to each sample and 45 ul Lysis Buffer 3 plus 150 ul elution buffer were added to each input sample that was previously set aside. To elute immunocomplexes from beads, samples were incubated at 65°C for 15 minutes on an Eppendorf Thermomixer shaking at 1000rpm. Tubes were centrifuged for 3min at 2000rpm at RT and 200µl of supernatant was transferred to a new tube and reverse crosslinked overnight at 65°C. Next day, 200 ul of TE was added to each decrosslinked sample, and the samples were treated sequentially with 0.2 mg/ml RNAse A (Sigma R5503) at 37°C and 0.2 ug/ml Proteinase K (NEB P8107S) at 55°C for two hours each. DNA purification was performed with the QIAquick PCR Purification Kit (Qiagen cat# 28106) and eluted in 50µl EB buffer and quantified by Qubit., Immunoprecipitated DNA was used to generate libraries using the NEBNext Ultra DNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina (New England Biolabs cat# 7370) following the manufacturer’s instructions.
column15: RNA-seq differential expression was determined using DESeq2 v1.18.1 and R (version 3.4.1) with q-value <0.05. Ruvseq v1.12.0 was used for factor analysis to remove count based on ERCC spike-in. GSEA analysis was performed using gsea-3.0.jar. These additional analysis steps were included in the Diderote LSF-RNAseq Pipeline., Homer annotatePeaks v4.8.3 was used for peak  annotation and for assigning peaks to genes., Bedtools v2.26.0 intersect was used to determine peak overlaps.

column38: Paired-end ATAC-seq fastq files were processed using the ATAC-seq Pipeline from the Kundaje Lab (https://github.com/kundajelab/atac_dnase_pipelines). Reads were trimmed using cutadapt v1.9.1 using the following parameters: -m 5. Reads were aligned to the hg19 genome using Bowtie2 v2.2.6, and the SAMtools v1.7 was used to convert the output files into the BAM format using default parameters. Duplicate reads were removed using Picard tool v1.126 using default parameters. Shuf was used to subsample reads to 50 million. Peaks were called using MACS2 v2.1.0 using default parameters
column39: Single-end ChIP-seq fastq files were processed using the AQUAS ChIP-seq Pipeline from the Kundaje Lab (https://github.com/kundajelab/chipseq_pipeline). Peaks were called/signal tracks were generated using MACS2 v2.1.0, and peaks with fold change > 4 compared to input and a FDR < 0.05 were used for subsequent analysis. column42: The processed data files are in bigWig format containing the indexed tag chromosome coordinates and score produced from MACS2 peak calling.
column46: Mammary gland ductal carcarcinoma epithelial cells derived from metastatic site

column12: T47D were maintained at 37°C with 5% CO2 and passaged every 2-3 days at a 1:3 split ratio, according to ATCC recommendations. Complete culture media comprised of RPMI-1640 that was supplemented with 10% FBS,10μg/ml insulin (Sigma-Aldrich cat# 91077C), 1x penicillin/streptomycin, and 1x glutamax. After transduction with LT3GEPIR-shRenilla Luciferase, cells were selected and maintained in media containing 2 ug/ml puromycin. Cells were treated with 100 ng/ml doxycycline for 5 days. After two days of doxycycline treatment, cells were washed and cultured in hormone-deprived media containing 100 ng/ml doxycycline for 3 days. After hormone deprivation, cells were treated with 10 nM estradiol for 24 hours before cross-linking with formaldehyde and collection for ChIP-seq.
column14: Cells were grown to 80% confluence on 150cm plates and washed once with PBS and fixed with 1% formaldehyde (Thermo Fisher #28908) in 10 ml PBS for 10 min. To quench the cross-linking reaction, 1/20 volume of 2.5 M glycine was added to the plate for a final concentration of 0.125M for 5 min. The supernatant was aspirated, and the cells were washed twice with 5 ml PBS and harvested on ice using cell scrapers into 15ml sonication tubes (Diagenode cat# C01020031). Cells were pelleted at 1000g for 5 min at 4°C, washed 1x with 5 ml cold PBS, and pelleted once more. Cell pellet collected from 6 plates of cells was resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 1 (50 mM HEPES-KOH, pH 7.5; 140 mM NaCl, 1mM EDTA, 10% glycerol, 0.5% NP-40, 0.25% Triton X-100), allowed to rotate for 10 min at 4°C, and pelleted at 1000 x g for 5 min at 4°C. Cells were then resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 2 (10 mM Tris-HCL pH 8.0, 200 mM NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, 0.5 mM EGTA), allowed to rotate for 10 min at room temperature, and pelleted at 1000 x g for 5 min at 4°C. Cells were then resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 3 (10 mM Tris-HCl pH 8, 100 mM NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, 0.5 mM EGTA, 0.1% Na-Deoxycholate, 0.5% N-lauroylsarcosine) and then sonicated on a Bioruptor Pico at 4°C for 20min of 30’’ ON-OFF cycles with 1.2 g of sonication beads. After sonication, samples were transferred to 2 separate 1.5 ml microtube and centrifuged at 20,000 x g for 15 minutes at 4°C. The supernatant was transferred to new 15 ml tubes. To check sonication efficiency, 20µl of sonicated samples was transferred to a new microtube with 80µl PBS and incubated at 65°C for 3hr on an Eppendorf Thermomixer shaking at 1000rpm to decrosslink. DNA was purified with the QIAquick PCR Purification Kit (Qiagen cat# 28106) and eluted in 50µl EB buffer. 1 ug of decrosslinked chromatin from each sample were run in a 1% agarose gel at 100V for 45min and imaged on a Bio-rad ChemiDoc XRS+. DNA concentration in the sonicated decrosslinked samples were measured via qubit, and this concentration was then used to estimate the concentration of chromatin in the un-decrosslinked samples. 30 ug of total chromatin and 50 ng of Spike-in chromatin (Active Motif 53083) weres transferred to a 1.5ml LoBind tube (Eppendorf cat# 0030108051) and brought up to 500µl final volume with Lysis Buffer 3. 5µl was removed as input material (1%) and placed in a separate microtube at 4°C. 2µg antibody was used for each histone ChIP, and 5ug was used for transcription factor ChIP (see Key Resources table for list of antibodies) along with 1ug of Spike-in antibodies (Active Motif 61686). Antibodies were pre-bound to 50 ul of Dynabeads Protein G (Thermo Fisher 10004D), which was washed in 1 ml of 0.5% BSA in 1x PBS three times before and after overnight pre-binding at 4°C. The chromatin samples were added to the pre-bound Dynabeads and rotated end-to-end overnight at 4°C. Beads were washed 5x with 1 ml Wash Buffer (50 mM Hepes-KOH, pH 7.6; 500 mM LiCl, 1 mM EDTA, 1% NP-40; 0.5% Na-Deoxycholate) and once with 1 ml TE containing 50 mM NaCl. Beads were dried after the last wash by removing as much TE as possible. 210 ul of Elution Buffer (50 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8; 10 mM EDTA, 1% SDS) was added to each sample and 45 ul Lysis Buffer 3 plus 150 ul elution buffer were added to each input sample that was previously set aside. To elute immunocomplexes from beads, samples were incubated at 65°C for 15 minutes on an Eppendorf Thermomixer shaking at 1000rpm. Tubes were centrifuged for 3min at 2000rpm at RT and 200µl of supernatant was transferred to a new tube and reverse crosslinked overnight at 65°C. Next day, 200 ul of TE was added to each decrosslinked sample, and the samples were treated sequentially with 0.2 mg/ml RNAse A (Sigma R5503) at 37°C and 0.2 ug/ml Proteinase K (NEB P8107S) at 55°C for two hours each. DNA purification was performed with the QIAquick PCR Purification Kit (Qiagen cat# 28106) and eluted in 50µl EB buffer and quantified by Qubit., Immunoprecipitated DNA was used to generate libraries using the NEBNext Ultra DNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina (New England Biolabs cat# 7370) following the manufacturer’s instructions.
column15: RNA-seq differential expression was determined using DESeq2 v1.18.1 and R (version 3.4.1) with q-value <0.05. Ruvseq v1.12.0 was used for factor analysis to remove count based on ERCC spike-in. GSEA analysis was performed using gsea-3.0.jar. These additional analysis steps were included in the Diderote LSF-RNAseq Pipeline., Homer annotatePeaks v4.8.3 was used for peak  annotation and for assigning peaks to genes., Bedtools v2.26.0 intersect was used to determine peak overlaps.

column38: Paired-end ATAC-seq fastq files were processed using the ATAC-seq Pipeline from the Kundaje Lab (https://github.com/kundajelab/atac_dnase_pipelines). Reads were trimmed using cutadapt v1.9.1 using the following parameters: -m 5. Reads were aligned to the hg19 genome using Bowtie2 v2.2.6, and the SAMtools v1.7 was used to convert the output files into the BAM format using default parameters. Duplicate reads were removed using Picard tool v1.126 using default parameters. Shuf was used to subsample reads to 50 million. Peaks were called using MACS2 v2.1.0 using default parameters
column39: Single-end ChIP-seq fastq files were processed using the AQUAS ChIP-seq Pipeline from the Kundaje Lab (https://github.com/kundajelab/chipseq_pipeline). column42: The processed data files are in bigWig format containing the indexed tag chromosome coordinates and score produced from MACS2 peak calling.
column46: Mammary gland ductal carcarcinoma epithelial cells derived from metastatic site

column12: T47D were maintained at 37°C with 5% CO2 and passaged every 2-3 days at a 1:3 split ratio, according to ATCC recommendations. Complete culture media comprised of RPMI-1640 that was supplemented with 10% FBS,10μg/ml insulin (Sigma-Aldrich cat# 91077C), 1x penicillin/streptomycin, and 1x glutamax. After transduction with pLKO-tet-on-shRING1B, cells were selected and maintained in media containing 2 ug/ml puromycin. Cells were treated with 100 ng/ml doxycycline for 5 days. After two days of doxycycline treatment, cells were washed and cultured in hormone-deprived media containing 100 ng/ml doxycycline for 3 days. After hormone deprivation, cells were treated with 10 nM estradiol for 24 hours before cross-linking with formaldehyde and collection for ChIP-seq.
column14: Cells were grown to 80% confluence on 150cm plates and washed once with PBS and fixed with 1% formaldehyde (Thermo Fisher #28908) in 10 ml PBS for 10 min. To quench the cross-linking reaction, 1/20 volume of 2.5 M glycine was added to the plate for a final concentration of 0.125M for 5 min. The supernatant was aspirated, and the cells were washed twice with 5 ml PBS and harvested on ice using cell scrapers into 15ml sonication tubes (Diagenode cat# C01020031). Cells were pelleted at 1000g for 5 min at 4°C, washed 1x with 5 ml cold PBS, and pelleted once more. Cell pellet collected from 6 plates of cells was resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 1 (50 mM HEPES-KOH, pH 7.5; 140 mM NaCl, 1mM EDTA, 10% glycerol, 0.5% NP-40, 0.25% Triton X-100), allowed to rotate for 10 min at 4°C, and pelleted at 1000 x g for 5 min at 4°C. Cells were then resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 2 (10 mM Tris-HCL pH 8.0, 200 mM NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, 0.5 mM EGTA), allowed to rotate for 10 min at room temperature, and pelleted at 1000 x g for 5 min at 4°C. Cells were then resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 3 (10 mM Tris-HCl pH 8, 100 mM NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, 0.5 mM EGTA, 0.1% Na-Deoxycholate, 0.5% N-lauroylsarcosine) and then sonicated on a Bioruptor Pico at 4°C for 20min of 30’’ ON-OFF cycles with 1.2 g of sonication beads. After sonication, samples were transferred to 2 separate 1.5 ml microtube and centrifuged at 20,000 x g for 15 minutes at 4°C. The supernatant was transferred to new 15 ml tubes. To check sonication efficiency, 20µl of sonicated samples was transferred to a new microtube with 80µl PBS and incubated at 65°C for 3hr on an Eppendorf Thermomixer shaking at 1000rpm to decrosslink. DNA was purified with the QIAquick PCR Purification Kit (Qiagen cat# 28106) and eluted in 50µl EB buffer. 1 ug of decrosslinked chromatin from each sample were run in a 1% agarose gel at 100V for 45min and imaged on a Bio-rad ChemiDoc XRS+. DNA concentration in the sonicated decrosslinked samples were measured via qubit, and this concentration was then used to estimate the concentration of chromatin in the un-decrosslinked samples. 30 ug of total chromatin and 50 ng of Spike-in chromatin (Active Motif 53083) weres transferred to a 1.5ml LoBind tube (Eppendorf cat# 0030108051) and brought up to 500µl final volume with Lysis Buffer 3. 5µl was removed as input material (1%) and placed in a separate microtube at 4°C. 2µg antibody was used for each histone ChIP, and 5ug was used for transcription factor ChIP (see Key Resources table for list of antibodies) along with 1ug of Spike-in antibodies (Active Motif 61686). Antibodies were pre-bound to 50 ul of Dynabeads Protein G (Thermo Fisher 10004D), which was washed in 1 ml of 0.5% BSA in 1x PBS three times before and after overnight pre-binding at 4°C. The chromatin samples were added to the pre-bound Dynabeads and rotated end-to-end overnight at 4°C. Beads were washed 5x with 1 ml Wash Buffer (50 mM Hepes-KOH, pH 7.6; 500 mM LiCl, 1 mM EDTA, 1% NP-40; 0.5% Na-Deoxycholate) and once with 1 ml TE containing 50 mM NaCl. Beads were dried after the last wash by removing as much TE as possible. 210 ul of Elution Buffer (50 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8; 10 mM EDTA, 1% SDS) was added to each sample and 45 ul Lysis Buffer 3 plus 150 ul elution buffer were added to each input sample that was previously set aside. To elute immunocomplexes from beads, samples were incubated at 65°C for 15 minutes on an Eppendorf Thermomixer shaking at 1000rpm. Tubes were centrifuged for 3min at 2000rpm at RT and 200µl of supernatant was transferred to a new tube and reverse crosslinked overnight at 65°C. Next day, 200 ul of TE was added to each decrosslinked sample, and the samples were treated sequentially with 0.2 mg/ml RNAse A (Sigma R5503) at 37°C and 0.2 ug/ml Proteinase K (NEB P8107S) at 55°C for two hours each. DNA purification was performed with the QIAquick PCR Purification Kit (Qiagen cat# 28106) and eluted in 50µl EB buffer and quantified by Qubit., Immunoprecipitated DNA was used to generate libraries using the NEBNext Ultra DNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina (New England Biolabs cat# 7370) following the manufacturer’s instructions.
column15: RNA-seq differential expression was determined using DESeq2 v1.18.1 and R (version 3.4.1) with q-value <0.05. Ruvseq v1.12.0 was used for factor analysis to remove count based on ERCC spike-in. GSEA analysis was performed using gsea-3.0.jar. These additional analysis steps were included in the Diderote LSF-RNAseq Pipeline., Homer annotatePeaks v4.8.3 was used for peak  annotation and for assigning peaks to genes., Bedtools v2.26.0 intersect was used to determine peak overlaps.

column38: Paired-end ATAC-seq fastq files were processed using the ATAC-seq Pipeline from the Kundaje Lab (https://github.com/kundajelab/atac_dnase_pipelines). Reads were trimmed using cutadapt v1.9.1 using the following parameters: -m 5. Reads were aligned to the hg19 genome using Bowtie2 v2.2.6, and the SAMtools v1.7 was used to convert the output files into the BAM format using default parameters. Duplicate reads were removed using Picard tool v1.126 using default parameters. Shuf was used to subsample reads to 50 million. Peaks were called using MACS2 v2.1.0 using default parameters
column39: Single-end ChIP-seq fastq files were processed using the AQUAS ChIP-seq Pipeline from the Kundaje Lab (https://github.com/kundajelab/chipseq_pipeline). column40: Single-end RNA-seq fastq files were processed using the LSF-RNAseq Pipeline from Diderote (https://github.com/diderote/LSF-RNAseq). Reads were trimmed using cutadapt v2.3 with the following parameters: -j 4 --netseq-trim
column42: The processed data files are in bigWig format containing the indexed tag chromosome coordinates and score produced from MACS2 peak calling.

column12: T47D were maintained at 37°C with 5% CO2 and passaged every 2-3 days at a 1:3 split ratio, according to ATCC recommendations. Complete culture media comprised of RPMI-1640 that was supplemented with 10% FBS,10μg/ml insulin (Sigma-Aldrich cat# 91077C), 1x penicillin/streptomycin, and 1x glutamax. Cells were hormone-deprived in charcoal-stripped media for 3 days before collection and RNA extraction for RNA-seq library preparation.
column14: RNA was isolated from frozen cell pellets using the TRIzol reagent (Thermo Fisher Scientific cat# 15596018) according to manufacturer's instructions. RNA quantity was measured on a nanodrop, and RNA was diluted to 100 ng/ul or less. A total of 1.5 ug to 2 ug of RNA in 20 ul of nuclease-free water was treated using the TURBO DNA-free Kit (Thermo Fisher AM1907) along the Routine DNase treatment guideline.
column15: RNA-seq differential expression was determined using DESeq2 v1.18.1 and R (version 3.4.1) with q-value <0.05. Ruvseq v1.12.0 was used for factor analysis to remove count based on ERCC spike-in. GSEA analysis was performed using gsea-3.0.jar. These additional analysis steps were included in the Diderote LSF-RNAseq Pipeline., Homer annotatePeaks v4.8.3 was used for peak  annotation and for assigning peaks to genes., Bedtools v2.26.0 intersect was used to determine peak overlaps.

column38: Paired-end ATAC-seq fastq files were processed using the ATAC-seq Pipeline from the Kundaje Lab (https://github.com/kundajelab/atac_dnase_pipelines). column12: T47D were maintained at 37°C with 5% CO2 and passaged every 2-3 days at a 1:3 split ratio, according to ATCC recommendations. Complete culture media comprised of RPMI-1640 that was supplemented with 10% FBS,10μg/ml insulin (Sigma-Aldrich cat# 91077C), 1x penicillin/streptomycin, and 1x glutamax. After transduction with lentivirus made using the pLVK-RNF2-R98A plasmid, Fluorescence-Activated Cell Sorting (FACS) was used to select cells whose mCherry expression levels were in the top 25% of all cells. Cells were expanded, and FACS was performed once more to remove any cells without mCherry expression. The re-sorted cells were expanded, and the mutant RING1B expression level was compared with the endogenous RING1B expression level using immunoblot to make sure that the two levels are similar. Cells were then transduced with pLKO-shRING1B, and transduced cells were selected using a puromycin concentration of 2ug/ml. After 7 days of selection, 5 x 10^5 cells were plated into each well on a six-well plate in charcoal-stripped media containin 2ug/ml puromycin. Cells were hormone-deprived for 3 days before collection and RNA extraction for library preparation.

column39: Single-end ChIP-seq fastq files were processed using the AQUAS ChIP-seq Pipeline from the Kundaje Lab (https://github.com/kundajelab/chipseq_pipeline). Reads were trimmed using cutadapt v1.9.1. Reads were aligned to the hg19 genome using Bowtie2 v2.2.6, and the SAMtools v1.7 was used to convert the output file to the BAM format. Duplicates were removed using Picard Tools v1.126. Peaks were called/signal tracks were generated using MACS2 v2.1.0, and peaks with fold change > 4 compared to input and a FDR < 0.05 were used for subsequent analysis. Only default parameters were used.
column40: Single-end RNA-seq fastq files were processed using the LSF-RNAseq Pipeline from Diderote (https://github.com/diderote/LSF-RNAseq). Reads were trimmed using cutadapt v2.3 with the following parameters: -j 4 --netseq-trim

column12: T47D were maintained at 37°C with 5% CO2 and passaged every 2-3 days at a 1:3 split ratio, according to ATCC recommendations. After transduction with pLKO-shCtrl, cells were selected and maintained in media containing 2 ug/ml puromycin. Cells were then hormone deprived for 3 days before 24 hours of 10 nM E2 treatment. column14: RNA was isolated from frozen cell pellets using the TRIzol reagent (Thermo Fisher Scientific cat# 15596018) according to manufacturer's instructions. column15: RNA-seq differential expression was determined using DESeq2 v1.18.1 and R (version 3.4.1) with q-value <0.05. Complete culture media comprised of RPMI-1640 that was supplemented with 10% FBS,10μg/ml insulin (Sigma-Aldrich cat# 91077C), 1x penicillin/streptomycin, and 1x glutamax. After transduction with pLKO-shCtrl, cells were selected and maintained in media containing 2 ug/ml puromycin. Cells were then hormone deprived for 3 days before 8 hours of 10 nM E2 treatment. Cells were then collected, and the pellets were frozen at -80°C for RNA extraction at a later date.
column14: RNA was isolated from frozen cell pellets using the TRIzol reagent (Thermo Fisher Scientific cat# 15596018) according to manufacturer's instructions. RNA quantity was measured on a nanodrop, and RNA was diluted to 100 ng/ul or less. A total of 1.5 ug to 2 ug of RNA in 20 ul of nuclease-free water was treated using the TURBO DNA-free Kit (Thermo Fisher AM1907) along the Routine DNase treatment guideline.
column15: RNA-seq differential expression was determined using DESeq2 v1.18.1 and R (version 3.4.1) with q-value <0.05. Ruvseq v1.12.0 was used for factor analysis to remove count based on ERCC spike-in. GSEA analysis was performed using gsea-3.0.jar. These additional analysis steps were included in the Diderote LSF-RNAseq Pipeline., Homer annotatePeaks v4.8.3 was used for peak  annotation and for assigning peaks to genes., Bedtools v2.26.0 intersect was used to determine peak overlaps.
column21: University of Miami Miller School of Medicine
column38: Paired-end ATAC-seq fastq files were processed using the ATAC-seq Pipeline from the Kundaje Lab (https://github.com/kundajelab/atac_dnase_pipelines). Reads were trimmed using cutadapt v1.9.1 using the following parameters: -m 5. Reads were aligned to the hg19 genome using Bowtie2 v2.2.6, and the SAMtools v1.7 was used to convert the output files into the BAM format using default parameters. Duplicate reads were removed using Picard tool v1.126 using default parameters. Shuf was used to subsample reads to 50 million. Peaks were called using MACS2 v2.1.0 using default parameters
column39: Single-end ChIP-seq fastq files were processed using the AQUAS ChIP-seq Pipeline from the Kundaje Lab (https://github.com/kundajelab/chipseq_pipeline). Reads were trimmed using cutadapt v1.9.1. Reads were aligned to the hg19 genome using Bowtie2 v2.2.6, and the SAMtools v1.7 was used to convert the output file to the BAM format. Duplicates were removed using Picard Tools v1.126. Peaks were called/signal tracks were generated using MACS2 v2.1.0, and peaks with fold change > 4 compared to input and a FDR < 0.05 were used for subsequent analysis. Only default parameters were used.
column40: Single-end RNA-seq fastq files were processed using the LSF-RNAseq Pipeline from Diderote (https://github.com/diderote/LSF-RNAseq). Reads were trimmed using cutadapt v2.3 with the following parameters: -j 4 --netseq-trim
column42: The processed data files are in bigWig format containing the indexed tag chromosome coordinates and score produced from MACS2 peak calling.

column12: T47D were maintained at 37°C with 5% CO2 and passaged every 2-3 days at a 1:3 split ratio, according to ATCC recommendations. Complete culture media comprised of RPMI-1640 that was supplemented with 10% FBS, 10μg/ml insulin (Sigma-Aldrich cat# 91077C), 1x penicillin/streptomycin, and 1x glutamax. Cells were cultured in hormone-deprived media for 3 days. After hormone deprivation, cells were crosslinked with formaldehyde and collected for ChIP-seq.
column14: The ChIP-exo 5.0 experiment was performed using the published protocol (Rossi et al. Nat Comm 2018) with minor adaptations in regards to chromatin preparation and the IP step. Cells were grown to 80% confluence on 150cm plates and washed once with PBS and fixed with 1% formaldehyde (Thermo Fisher #28908) in 10 ml PBS for 10 min. To quench the cross-linking reaction, 1/20 volume of 2.5 M glycine was added to the plate for a final concentration of 0.125M for 5 min. The supernatant was aspirated, and the cells were washed twice with 5 ml PBS and harvested on ice using cell scrapers into 15ml sonication tubes (Diagenode cat# C01020031). Cells were pelleted at 1000g for 5 min at 4°C, washed 1x with 5 ml cold PBS, and pelleted once more. Cell pellet collected from 6 plates of cells was resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 1 (50 mM HEPES-KOH, pH 7.5; 140 mM NaCl, 1mM EDTA, 10% glycerol, 0.5% NP-40, 0.25% Triton X-100), allowed to rotate for 10 min at 4°C, and pelleted at 1000 x g for 5 min at 4°C. Cells were then resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 2 (10 mM Tris-HCL pH 8.0, 200 mM NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, 0.5 mM EGTA), allowed to rotate for 10 min at room temperature, and pelleted at 1000 x g for 5 min at 4°C. Cells were then resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 3 (10 mM Tris-HCl pH 8, 100 mM NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, 0.5 mM EGTA, 0.1% Na-Deoxycholate, 0.5% N-lauroylsarcosine) and then sonicated on a Bioruptor Pico at 4°C for 20min of 30’’ ON-OFF cycles with 1.2 g of sonication beads. After sonication, samples were transferred to 2 separate 1.5 ml microtube and centrifuged at 20, 000 x g for 15 minutes at 4°C. The supernatant was transferred to new 15 ml tubes. To check sonication efficiency, 20µl of sonicated samples was transferred to a new microtube with 80µl PBS and incubated at 65°C for 3hr on an Eppendorf Thermomixer shaking at 1000rpm to decrosslink. DNA was purified with the QIAquick PCR Purification Kit (Qiagen cat# 28106) and eluted in 50µl EB buffer. 1 ug of decrosslinked chromatin from each sample were run in a 1% agarose gel at 100V for 45min and imaged on a Bio-rad ChemiDoc XRS+. DNA concentration in the sonicated decrosslinked samples were measured via qubit, and this concentration was then used to estimate the concentration of chromatin in the un-decrosslinked samples. 120 ug of total chromatin were transferred equally to two 1.5ml LoBind tubes (Eppendorf cat# 0030108051) and each was brought up to a final volume of 500µl with Lysis Buffer 3. 10 ug of antibodies were use for transcription factor ChIP (see Key Resources table for list of antibodies), which was divided equally into two and individually pre-bound to 10 ul of Protein A Mag Sepharose Beads (GE Healthcare 28944006). The beads were washed in 1 ml of 0.5% BSA in 1x PBS three times before and after overnight pre-binding at 4°C. The chromatin samples were added to the pre-bound Dynabeads and rotated end-to-end overnight at 4°C. The beads were collected on the magnetic rack and sequentially washed with 500 uL FA Lysis Buffer, NaCl Buffer, LiCl Buffer, and 10 mM Tris-HCl buffer pH 8.0, all at 4°C. The rest of the reaction and the library preparation were performed exactly as described in the previously cited paper., Library preparation was performed as described (Rossi et al. nat Comm 2018) with minor adaptations in regards to the oligonucleotides used. NEBNext Multiplex Oligos for Illumina Set 1 was used in place of ExA2_iNN. NEBNext Universal PCR Primer for Illumina was used instead of ExA1-58. All other oligos were synthesized from Sigma except for ExA1-SSL_N5, which was ordered from IDT with 5 random basepairs at the beginning of the oligo.
column15: RNA-seq differential expression was determined using DESeq2 v1.18.1 and R (version 3.4.1) with q-value <0.05. Ruvseq v1.12.0 was used for factor analysis to remove count based on ERCC spike-in. GSEA analysis was performed using gsea-3.0.jar. These additional analysis steps were included in the Diderote LSF-RNAseq Pipeline., Homer annotatePeaks v4.8.3 was used for peak  annotation and for assigning peaks to genes., Bedtools v2.26.0 intersect was used to determine peak overlaps.
column21: University of Miami Miller School of Medicine
column38: Paired-end ATAC-seq fastq files were processed using the ATAC-seq Pipeline from the Kundaje Lab (https://github.com/kundajelab/atac_dnase_pipelines). Reads were trimmed using cutadapt v1.9.1 using the following parameters: -m 5. Reads were aligned to the hg19 genome using Bowtie2 v2.2.6, and the SAMtools v1.7 was used to convert the output files into the BAM format using default parameters. Duplicate reads were removed using Picard tool v1.126 using default parameters. Shuf was used to subsample reads to 50 million. Peaks were called using MACS2 v2.1.0 using default parameters
column39: Single-end ChIP-seq fastq files were processed using the AQUAS ChIP-seq Pipeline from the Kundaje Lab (https://github.com/kundajelab/chipseq_pipeline). Reads were trimmed using cutadapt v1.9.1. Reads were aligned to the hg19 genome using Bowtie2 v2.2.6, and the SAMtools v1.7 was used to convert the output file to the BAM format. Duplicates were removed using Picard Tools v1.126. Peaks were called/signal tracks were generated using MACS2 v2.1.0, and peaks with fold change > 4 compared to input and a FDR < 0.05 were used for subsequent analysis. Only default parameters were used.
column40: Single-end RNA-seq fastq files were processed using the LSF-RNAseq Pipeline from Diderote (https://github.com/diderote/LSF-RNAseq). Reads were trimmed using cutadapt v2.3 with the following parameters: -j 4 --netseq-trim

Reads were aligned to the hg19 genome using Bowtie2 v2.2.6, and the SAMtools v1.7 was used to convert the output files into the BAM format using default parameters. Duplicate reads were removed using Picard tool v1.126 using default parameters. Shuf was used to subsample reads to 50 million. Peaks were called using MACS2 v2.1.0 using default parameters
column39: Single-end ChIP-seq fastq files were processed using the AQUAS ChIP-seq Pipeline from the Kundaje Lab (https://github.com/kundajelab/chipseq_pipeline). Reads were trimmed using cutadapt v1.9.1. Reads were aligned to the hg19 genome using Bowtie2 v2.2.6, and the SAMtools v1.7 was used to convert the output file to the BAM format. Duplicates were removed using Picard Tools v1.126. Peaks were called/signal tracks were generated using MACS2 v2.1.0, and peaks with fold change > 4 compared to input and a FDR < 0.05 were used for subsequent analysis. Only default parameters were used.
column40: Single-end RNA-seq fastq files were processed using the LSF-RNAseq Pipeline from Diderote (https://github.com/diderote/LSF-RNAseq). Reads were trimmed using cutadapt v2.3 with the following parameters: -j 4 --netseq-trim
column42: The processed data files are in bigWig format containing the indexed tag chromosome coordinates and score produced from MACS2 peak calling.
column46: Mammary gland ductal carcarcinoma epithelial cells derived from metastatic site
column52: FASTQ data were processed using cutadapt v1.15 (--netseq-trim

column12: T47D were maintained at 37°C with 5% CO2 and passaged every 2-3 days at a 1:3 split ratio, according to ATCC recommendations. Complete culture media comprised of RPMI-1640 that was supplemented with 10% FBS, 10μg/ml insulin (Sigma-Aldrich cat# 91077C), 1x penicillin/streptomycin, and 1x glutamax. Cells were cultured in hormone-deprived media for 3 days. After hormone deprivation, cells were crosslinked with formaldehyde and collected for ChIP-exo.
column14: The ChIP-exo 5.0 experiment was performed using the published protocol (Rossi et al. Nat Comm 2018) with minor adaptations in regards to chromatin preparation and the IP step. Cells were grown to 80% confluence on 150cm plates and washed once with PBS and fixed with 1% formaldehyde (Thermo Fisher #28908) in 10 ml PBS for 10 min. To quench the cross-linking reaction, 1/20 volume of 2.5 M glycine was added to the plate for a final concentration of 0.125M for 5 min. The supernatant was aspirated, and the cells were washed twice with 5 ml PBS and harvested on ice using cell scrapers into 15ml sonication tubes (Diagenode cat# C01020031). Cells were pelleted at 1000g for 5 min at 4°C, washed 1x with 5 ml cold PBS, and pelleted once more. Cell pellet collected from 6 plates of cells was resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 1 (50 mM HEPES-KOH, pH 7.5; 140 mM NaCl, 1mM EDTA, 10% glycerol, 0.5% NP-40, 0.25% Triton X-100), allowed to rotate for 10 min at 4°C, and pelleted at 1000 x g for 5 min at 4°C. Cells were then resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 2 (10 mM Tris-HCL pH 8.0, 200 mM NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, 0.5 mM EGTA), allowed to rotate for 10 min at room temperature, and pelleted at 1000 x g for 5 min at 4°C. Cells were then resuspended in 3 ml of Lysis Buffer 3 (10 mM Tris-HCl pH 8, 100 mM NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, 0.5 mM EGTA, 0.1% Na-Deoxycholate, 0.5% N-lauroylsarcosine) and then sonicated on a Bioruptor Pico at 4°C for 20min of 30’’ ON-OFF cycles with 1.2 g of sonication beads. After sonication, samples were transferred to 2 separate 1.5 ml microtube and centrifuged at 20, 000 x g for 15 minutes at 4°C. The supernatant was transferred to new 15 ml tubes. To check sonication efficiency, 20µl of sonicated samples was transferred to a new microtube with 80µl PBS and incubated at 65°C for 3hr on an Eppendorf Thermomixer shaking at 1000rpm to decrosslink. DNA was purified with the QIAquick PCR Purification Kit (Qiagen cat# 28106) and eluted in 50µl EB buffer. 1 ug of decrosslinked chromatin from each sample were run in a 1% agarose gel at 100V for 45min and imaged on a Bio-rad ChemiDoc XRS+. DNA concentration in the sonicated decrosslinked samples were measured via qubit, and this concentration was then used to estimate the concentration of chromatin in the un-decrosslinked samples. 120 ug of total chromatin were transferred equally to two 1.5ml LoBind tubes (Eppendorf cat# 0030108051) and each was brought up to a final volume of 500µl with Lysis Buffer 3. 10 ug of antibodies were use for transcription factor ChIP (see Key Resources table for list of antibodies), which was divided equally into two and individually pre-bound to 10 ul of Protein A Mag Sepharose Beads (GE Healthcare 28944006). The beads were washed in 1 ml of 0.5% BSA in 1x PBS three times before and after overnight pre-binding at 4°C. The chromatin samples were added to the pre-bound Dynabeads and rotated end-to-end overnight at 4°C. The beads were collected on the magnetic rack and sequentially washed with 500 uL FA Lysis Buffer, NaCl Buffer, LiCl Buffer, and 10 mM Tris-HCl buffer pH 8.0, all at 4°C. The rest of the reaction and the library preparation were performed exactly as described in the previously cited paper., Library preparation was performed as described (Rossi et al. nat Comm 2018) with minor adaptations in regards to the oligonucleotides used. NEBNext Multiplex Oligos for Illumina Set 1 was used in place of ExA2_iNN. NEBNext Universal PCR Primer for Illumina was used instead of ExA1-58. All other oligos were synthesized from Sigma except for ExA1-SSL_N5, which was ordered from IDT with 5 random basepairs at the beginning of the oligo.
column15: RNA-seq differential expression was determined using DESeq2 v1.18.1 and R (version 3.4.1) with q-value <0.05. Ruvseq v1.12.0 was used for factor analysis to remove count based on ERCC spike-in. GSEA analysis was performed using gsea-3.0.jar. These additional analysis steps were included in the Diderote LSF-RNAseq Pipeline., Homer annotatePeaks v4.8.3 was used for peak  annotation and for assigning peaks to genes., Bedtools v2.26.0 intersect was used to determine peak overlaps.
